title: Rise in Australian Inflation Expectations Stokes Case for Higher Rates
sub_head: Inflation expectations rose 0.1 percentage points to 5.1%, the highest since December 2014
body:
SYDNEYâ€”Australian inflation expectations rose to their highest level in more than seven years last week, something that is likely to put further upward pressure on wage growth and burnish the case for an interest rate rise before the end of this year.
Inflation expectations rose 0.1 percentage points to 5.1%, the highest since December 2014, according to a survey by the ANZ Bank and pollster Roy Morgan.
The...
